sections.purpose: To provide a stable, controlled temperature for the growth of bacterial cultures.
sections.scope: Applicable to routine bacterial cultivation in Microbiology.
procedure: Ensure the interior is clean and free from contamination.
Switch ON the power and set the required temperature (e.g., 37Â°C).
Allow the temperature to stabilize for at least 1 hour.
Place the inoculated plates or tubes on the shelves.
Ensure the door is closed and latched properly.
Monitor and record the internal temperature twice daily.
Check for any signs of contamination or overgrowth periodically.
Clean the interior with 70% ethanol weekly.
Turn OFF the heater if the incubator is not in use for extended periods.
precautions: Do not block the air vents inside the chamber.
Avoid frequent and prolonged opening of the door.
Use secondary containers for liquid cultures to catch spills.
Notify a supervisor if the temperature deviates from the set point.
Calibration of the thermostat should be performed annually.
